FASH 200.courseDesc: Introduction to responsible/ sustainable practices for ethical design, development and marketing of fashion product. Course includes the exploration of global and regional markets engaged in these practices.
FASH 200.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 205.courseDesc: This course delves into the exploration of the social and psychological dimensions of appearance and the human body, shedding light on their role in shaping hierarchies of privilege and power within the realm of fashion design. By examining the significance of appearance, rooted in the body, through the lens of social and critical theory, we unravel how it interconnects with the principles, conduct, and standards of fashion design. Through the application of these theoretical frameworks, we probe into various subject positions to gain insights into the current landscape of fashion design. This course equips students with the knowledge to inspire transformative change throughout the fashion industry.
FASH 205.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 211.courseDesc: This course examines the fashion figure, silhouette, proportion, movement and exaggerated expression using a range of live models. Emphasis of artistic style is encouraged.
FASH 211.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 212.courseDesc: Examines fashion forms, fabrication, and conceptual design through the use of color and mixed media. Works toward the development of a personal "fashion look" and an understanding of drawing as it relates to the fashion industry. Includes live model.
FASH 212.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 231.courseDesc: Examines textile manufacturing and sustainable practices within the industry. Basic textile terminology and production processes are introduced including aesthetics, performance and care characteristics.
FASH 231.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 241.courseDesc: Develops a proficiency in basic garment construction. Emphasizes facility with industrial equipment. Introduces production techniques and an overall awareness of standards of quality.
FASH 241.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 304.courseDesc: This course examines the relationship of fibers, processes and textile creation and form as it relates to the body.
FASH 304.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 304.prereqs: VSST 103 [Min Grade D] or VSST 106 [Min Grade D]

FASH 309.courseDesc: Introduces digital skills and presentation techniques used for communication in the fashion industry. Students will be introduced to research–based design practice.
FASH 309.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 309.prereqs: (VSST 102 [Min Grade D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade D]) and (FASH 200 [Min Grade D] or DSMR 103 [Min Grade D])

FASH 312.courseDesc: Investigates traditional and digital techniques of surface design. This course explores aesthetics, color theory, motif development and layout for use in multiple fashion categories.
FASH 312.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 312.prereqs: VSST 102 [Min Grade D] or VSST 105 [Min Grade D]

FASH 314.courseDesc: Requires the creation of a portfolio of original designs executed in a medium of choice. Explores various market segments of the industry and includes project reviews by critics who are specialists in these areas.
FASH 314.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 314.prereqs: FASH 313 [Min Grade D] or FASH 318 [Min Grade D]

FASH 315.courseDesc: Develops skills in digital patternmaking, grading and marker-making. Process is tested with a muslin prototype and a final garment.
FASH 315.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 318.courseDesc: Fashion data visualization for use in the design and manufacturing of fashion product. Students create accurate flat sketches, line sheets and detailed technical packs for product life cycle management.
FASH 318.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 318.prereqs: FASH 309 [Min Grade D] or FASH 310 [Min Grade D]

FASH 319.courseDesc: Students explore clo 3-D virtual garment simulation. Draping directly on the avatar, individual designs are realized through a zero-waste process. Material properties are tested on the avatar in motion.
FASH 319.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 319.prereqs: FASH 318 [Min Grade D] or FASH 316 [Min Grade D]

FASH 324.courseDesc: This is an advanced level of Fashion Design in 3D Space. Students will work on special 3D Fashion projects and/or a self-directed project.
FASH 324.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 324.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits

FASH 334.courseDesc: Using 3D virtual design software, students create historic and futuristic 3D costume design to enhance a virtual story. Through historical costume research students will learn how to use costume design to develop narrative. This course is open to students across the University.
FASH 334.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 334.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits

FASH 335.fullName: History of Costume I: Preclassical to 1800
FASH 335.courseDesc: Traces the rise of Western costume from the ancient world through 1800, including political, economic, and social influence on aesthetic development in dress. This is a writing intensive course.
FASH 335.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 336.courseDesc: Traces the history of costume from 1800 through 1920, including the political, economic, and social influence on aesthetic development in dress. This is a writing intensive course.
FASH 336.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 337.fullName: History of Costume III: 1920 to Present
FASH 337.courseDesc: Examines fashion and dress trends from 1920 through the 21st century within their sociocultural, political, and economic contexts. The course also explores how globalization, technology, and mass media impact the aesthetics of dress.
FASH 337.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 341.courseDesc: Explores basic patternmaking techniques and manipulations and establishes comparisons between drafting and draping techniques in the development of standard slopers.
FASH 341.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 342.courseDesc: Advances the skills ofFASH 341. Includes an introduction to basic draping and how to translate on to paper.
FASH 342.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 343.courseDesc: Provides intensive investigation of materials and construction techniques used in tailoring. Uses a combination of garment production methods, including a strong emphasis on couture practices.
FASH 343.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 348.fullName: Fashion Design I: Fabric to Form
FASH 348.courseDesc: Exploring unconventional sources for design research, students use problem solving in design to take concepts from 2-D to 3-D with an emphasis on materials.
FASH 348.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 348.prereqs: (VSST 304 [Min Grade D] or FASH 304 [Min Grade D]) and FASH 342 [Min Grade D]

FASH 353.courseDesc: Survey of knitwear design development includes yarn identification and knitted structures. Students apply hands-on digital knitting technology with SES APEX software and Shima Seiki electronic knitting machines in the design process.
FASH 353.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 353.prereqs: FASH 348 [Min Grade D] or FASH 349 [Min Grade D]

FASH 354.courseDesc: Using responsible eco-friendly concepts, students design original collections for men’s and women’s wear. Zero waste design, up-cycling and de-reconstruction methods are considered in the circular design process.
FASH 354.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 354.prereqs: FASH 353 [Min Grade D] or FASH 350 [Min Grade D]

FASH 355.fullName: Fashion Design IV: Collection Research & Development
FASH 355.courseDesc: Expands and broadens technical skills and lays the groundwork for development of the senior thesis collection. This includes design research and prototype development.
FASH 355.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 355.prereqs: FASH 354 [Min Grade D] or FASH 351 [Min Grade D]

FASH 433.courseDesc: Expands and broadens technical skills and lays the groundwork for development of the senior collection. Includes couture evening wear techniques and research processes.
FASH 433.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 433.prereqs: FASH 351 [Min Grade D] or FASH 354 [Min Grade D]

FASH 450.courseDesc: Machine Knitting is an introduction to knitwear design specialization. Students learn to style and draw knit garments to develop a professional portfolio. Technical information regarding yarn analysis, stitch construction, pattern and garment construction are the focus of this class.
FASH 450.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 450.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 3 times for 12 credits
FASH 450.prereqs: FASH 241 [Min Grade D] and (VSST 112 [Min Grade D] or VSST 113 [Min Grade D])

FASH 451.courseDesc: This course provides students with concepts and skills to design traditional and contemporary fashion accessories with emphasis in embroidery; applique; hand painting; and clay, plastic and ceramic work.
FASH 451.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 453.courseDesc: This course will offer an introduction to the foundations and sleepwear marketplace. Primary focus will be on the design and execution of two pieces for this market. Students will learn how to construct a bra (molded cups) and how to incorporate these details into their final looks for this market. In addition, students will learn the safe operation of the specialty sewing machines for knit construction.
FASH 453.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 453.prereqs: FASH 251 [Min Grade D] or FASH 349 [Min Grade D] or FASH 348 [Min Grade D]

FASH 455.courseDesc: Advanced Machine Knitting is a further exploration into the software and machinery used in knit product production. Students will participate in all stages of product development from yarn and stitch selection, swatch sampling, gauge analysis, pattern writing, knitting output, and assembly methods.
FASH 455.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 455.repeatStatus: Can be repeated 2 times for 9 credits

FASH 464.courseDesc: This course will involve research, development and execution of a finished fashion design portfolio. Students will create a physical and electronic portfolio for the global marketplace.
FASH 464.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 466.courseDesc: Presents the following topics in seminar fashion merchandising, retail distribution, interpreting consumer demand, merchandise assortment planning, unit and inventory control and pricing, fashion marketing and manufacturing, including the marketing process, components of the fashion industry, market evaluation, demographic and psychological factors, manufacturing components and processes, and case studies.
FASH 466.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH 491.courseDesc: The second of a three-part series in which the student develops the senior collection. Requires the student to demonstrate the synthesis of a personal aesthetic and technical acumen.
FASH 491.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH 491.prereqs: FASH 352 [Min Grade D] or FASH 355 [Min Grade D]

FASH 492.courseDesc: Requires completion of senior collection and presentation in student fashion show.
FASH 492.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design

FASH I199.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
FASH I199.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH I199.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

FASH I299.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
FASH I299.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH I299.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

FASH I399.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
FASH I399.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH I399.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

FASH I499.courseDesc: Self-directed within the area of study requiring intermittent consultation with a designated instructor.
FASH I499.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH I499.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

FASH T180.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
FASH T180.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH T180.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

FASH T280.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
FASH T280.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH T280.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

FASH T380.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
FASH T380.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH T380.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit

FASH T480.courseDesc: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.
FASH T480.courseDepartment: Antoinette Westphal College of Media Arts & Design
FASH T480.repeatStatus: Can be repeated multiple times for credit
